translated: The rain of blood, the rain of honey and dust, or whatever other terrible and undesirable rain there is,

original: dviṣantam ete anu yantu sarve parāñco yantu nirvartamānāḥ //
analyzed: dviṣantam ete anu yantu sarve parāñcaḥ yantu nirvartamānāḥ
translated: let all of these follow the one who hates us. Let them turn back and go away.
Having offered to Agni,
the divine Gandharva,
one should offer with the names of the mothers.
A Brahmin should give a good bull to the performer,

analyzed: sīram vaiśyoaśvam prādeśikaḥ grāma varam rājā
translated: a plow to the local people, and the best village to the king.
That is the atonement there.

original: atha yakṣāṇi dṛśyante tad śvāpado vāyasaḥ puruṣarūpam iti tad evam āśaṅkyam eva bhavati
analyzed: atha yatra etāni yakṣāṇi dṛśyante tat yathā etat markaṭaḥ śvāpadaḥ vāyasaḥ puruṣa rūpam iti tat evam āśaṅkyam eva bhavati
translated: Then if jackals, dogs, or crows are seen in human form, it is to be suspected in that way.
There one should offer:

original: yan markaṭaḥ śvāpado vāyaso yadīdaṃ rāṣṭraṃ jātavedaḥ patāti puruṣarakṣasaṃ iṣiraṃ yat patāti /
analyzed: yat markaṭaḥ śvāpadaḥ vāyasaḥ yadi idam rāṣṭram jātavedaḥ patāti puruṣarakṣasam iṣiram yat patāti
translated: If a monkey, a jackal, a crow, or whatever else in this kingdom, O all-knower, flies away, or if a human-like creature flies away,

original: dviṣantam ete anu yantu sarve parāñco yantu nivartamānāḥ //
analyzed: dviṣantam ete anu yantu sarve parāñcaḥ yantu nivartamānāḥ
translated: let all of these follow the one who hates us. Let them turn back and go away.
Having offered to Agni,
the divine Gandharva,
one should offer with the names of the mothers.
That is the atonement there.

original: atha ha gomāyū nāma maṇḍūkau yatra vadatas tad māṃ prati vadato māṃ prati vadata iti tad evam āśaṅkyam eva
analyzed: atha ha gomāyū nāma maṇḍūkau yatra vadataḥ tat yat manyante mām prati vadataḥ mām prati vadataḥ iti tat evam āśaṅkyam eva
translated: Then if two frogs named Gomāyu croak where one is speaking, one should suspect that they are speaking to me, and
one should offer there.

original: yad gomāyū vadato jātavedo 'nyayā vācābhi jañjabhātaḥ /
analyzed: yat gomāyū vadataḥ jātavedaḥ nyayā vācā abhi jañjabhātaḥ
translated: If the two Gomāyu croak, O Jātavedas, with another voice,

original: rathaṃtaraṃ bṛhac ca sāmaitad dviṣantam etāv abhi nānadaitām //
analyzed: rathaṃtaram bṛhat ca sāma etat dviṣantam etau abhi nānadaitām
translated: may these two sound forth against the enemy with the Sāman Rathantera and Bṛhat.

original: rathaṃtareṇa tvā bṛhac chamayāmi bṛhatā tvā rathaṭaraṃ śamayāmi /
analyzed: rathaṃtareṇa tvā bṛhat śamayāmi bṛhatā tvā rathaṭaram śamayāmi
translated: With Rathantera I appease you, with Bṛhat I appease you.

original: indrāgnī tvā brahmaṇā vāvṛdhānāv āyuṣmantāv uttamaṃ tvā karāthaḥ //
analyzed: indra agnī tvā brahmaṇā vāvṛdhānau āyuṣmantau uttamam tvā karāthaḥ
translated: May Indra and Agni, who have increased you through the Brahman, who are long-lived, make you the best.
To Indra and Agni, svāhā.
Having offered,
the divine Gandharva
one should offer with the names of the mother.
That is the atonement there.

original: atha kulaṃ kalahi bhavati tan nirṛtigṛhītam ity ācakṣate
analyzed: atha yatra etat kulam kalahi bhavati tat nirṛtigṛhītam iti ācakṣate
translated: Then if a family quarrels, they say that it is seized by Nirṛti.
One should offer there.
Far away is hostility, two (verses).

original: ayāś cāgne 'sy anabhiśastiś ca satyam it tvam ayā asi /
analyzed: ayās ca agne si an abhiśastiḥ ca satyam id tvam ayās asi
translated: You are the innocent one, O Agni, and the uncensured one. Truly you are the innocent one.

original: ayāsā manasā kṛto 'yās san ed / 'yāsya havyam ūhiṣe /
analyzed: ayāsā manasā kṛtaḥ yāḥ san ā id yā asya havyam ūhiṣe
translated: Made innocent by the mind, innocent, I carry your innocent oblation.
Bring us the remedy, O innocent one.

original: MS / / / / / KS / / / / KauśS / / etc / //🔽svāhā agnau hutvā
analyzed: ms ks kauśs  svāhā iti agnau hutvā
translated: Msm
Homa offerings should be made.

original: ārād agniṃ kravyādaṃ nirūhañ jivātave te paridhiṃ dadhāmi /
analyzed: ārāt agnim kravyādam nirūham jivātave te paridhim dadhāmi
translated: I drive away from afar the flesh-eating Agni, I set around thee a fence for thy life.

original: indrāgnī tvā brahmaṇā vāvṛdhānāv āyuṣmantāv uttamaṃ tvā karāthaḥ //
analyzed: indra agnī tvā brahmaṇā vāvṛdhānau āyuṣmantau uttamam tvā karāthaḥ
translated: Indra and Agni, may they make thee grow with holy power, may they make thee the most long-lived.
To Indra and Agni, hail!
Having offered,
Let Nirrti depart.
With this hymn one should offer.

original: apeta etu nirṛtir nehāsyā api kiṃ cana /🔽apāsyāḥ satvanaḥ pāśān mṛtyūn ekaśataṃ nude //
analyzed: apetaḥ etu nirṛtiḥ na iha asyāḥ api kim cana  apa asyāḥ satvanaḥ pāśāt mṛtyūn eka śatam nude
translated: Let Nirrti depart from here, let her do nothing here.🔽Drive away the snares of the living being, drive away the hundred and one deaths.

original: ye te pāśā ekaśataṃ mṛtyo martyāya hantave /🔽tāṃs te yajñasya māyayā sarvā /
analyzed: ye te pāśāḥ eka śatam mṛtyo martyāya hantave  tān te yajñasya māyayā sarvā
translated: The hundred and one snares of thine, O Death, for slaying the mortal,
We appease them all with the power of the sacrifice.

original: nir ito yantu nairṛtyā mṛtyava ekaśataṃ paraḥ sedhāmaiṣāṃ yat tamaḥ prāṇaṃ jyotiś ca dadhmahe //
analyzed: niḥ itas yantu nairṛtyāḥ mṛtyavaḥ eka śatam paras sedhāma eṣām yat tamaḥ prāṇam jyotiḥ ca dadhmahe
translated: Let the hundred and one deaths, the Nirrtis, depart from here. We drive away from them their utmost darkness, and place life and light in them.

original: PS / / ye te śataṃ varuṇa ye sahasraṃ yajñiyāḥ pāśā vitatā mahāntaḥ /
analyzed: ye te śatam varuṇa ye sahasram yajñiyāḥ pāśāḥ vitatāḥ mahāntaḥ
translated: O Varuna, thy hundred, thy thousand, the great bonds that are to be respected,

original: tebhyo asmān varuṇaḥ soma indro viśve muñcantu marutaḥ svarkāḥ //
analyzed: tebhyaḥ asmān varuṇaḥ somaḥ indraḥ viśve muñcantu marutaḥ su arkāḥ
translated: May Varuna, Soma, Indra, the Maruts, the dwellers in heaven, release us from them all.

original: PS / / brahma bhrājad udagād antarikṣaṃ divaṃ ca brahmāvādhūṣṭāmṛtena mṛtyum /
analyzed: brahma bhrājat udagāt antarikṣam divam ca brahma avādhūṣṭa amṛtena mṛtyum
translated: The Brahman has risen shining, the atmosphere and the sky. The Brahman has driven away death with the immortal.

original: brahmopadraṣṭā sukṛtasya sākṣād brahmāsmad apa hantu śamalaṃ tamaś ca // PS / /
analyzed: brahmā upadraṣṭā sukṛtasya sākṣāt brahmā asmat apa hantu śamalam tamaḥ ca
translated: The Brahman is the direct witness of good deeds. May the Brahman remove our impurity and darkness.
The excellent ox, and so on, is the same.

analyzed: atha yatra etat bhūmicalaḥ bhavati tatra juhuyāt
translated: Then if there is an earthquake, one should offer:

original: acyutā dyaur acyutam antarikṣam acyutā bhūmir diśo acyutā imāḥ /
analyzed: acyutā dyauḥ acyutam antarikṣam acyutā bhūmiḥ diśaḥ acyutāḥ imāḥ
translated: The unshaken sky, the unshaken atmosphere, the unshaken earth, and these unshaken directions,

original: acyuto 'yaṃ rodhāvarodhād dhruvo rāṣṭre prati tiṣṭhāmi jiṣṇuḥ //
analyzed: acyutaḥ yam rodha avarodhāt dhruvaḥ rāṣṭre prati tiṣṭhāmi jiṣṇuḥ
translated: The unshaken one, firm from obstruction, I stand in the kingdom, victorious.

original: yathā sūryo divi rocate yathāntarikṣaṃ mātariśvābhivaste /
analyzed: yathā sūryaḥ divi rocate yathā antarikṣam mātariśvā abhivaste
translated: As the sun shines in the sky, as the atmosphere is covered by the wind,

original: yathāgniḥ pṛthivīmā viveśaivāyaṃ dhruvo acyuto astu jiṣṇuḥ //
analyzed: yathā agniḥ pṛthivīm ā viveśa eva ayam dhruvaḥ acyutaḥ astu jiṣṇuḥ
translated: As the fire has entered the earth, so may this firm, unshaken one be victorious.

original: yathā devo divi stanayan vi rājati yathā varṣaṃ varṣakāmāya varṣati /
analyzed: yathā devaḥ divi stanayan vi rājati yathā varṣam varṣa kāmāya varṣati
translated: As the god shines in the sky thundering, as the rain rains for the one who desires rain,

original: yathāpaḥ pṛthivīmā viviśur evāyaṃ dhruvo acyuto astu jiṣṇuḥ //
analyzed: yathā āpaḥ pṛthivīm ā viviśuḥ eva ayam dhruvaḥ acyutaḥ astu jiṣṇuḥ
translated: As the waters have entered the earth, so may this firm, unshaken one be victorious.

original: yathā purīṣaṃ nadyaḥ samudram ahorātre apramādaṃ kṣaranti /
analyzed: yathā purīṣam nadyaḥ samudram ahar rātre apramādam kṣaranti
translated: As the rivers carry the earth to the ocean, as the day and night flow without fail,

original: evā viśaḥ saṃmanaso havaṃ me 'pramādam ihopa yantu sarvāḥ //
analyzed: eva viśaḥ saṃmanasaḥ havam me pramādam iha upa yantu sarvāḥ
translated: So may all the clans, with one mind, come to this invocation of mine, without delay.

original: dṛṃhatāṃ devī saha devatābhir dhruvā dṛḍhācyutā me astu bhūmiḥ /
analyzed: dṛṃhatām devī saha devatābhiḥ dhruvā dṛḍhā acyutā me astu bhūmiḥ
translated: Firm be the goddess with the deities; firm, unmoving, may the earth be for me.

original: sarvapāpmānam apanudyāsmad amitrān me dviṣato 'nu vidhyatu //
analyzed: sarva pāpmānam apanudya asmat amitrān me dviṣataḥ nu vidhyatu
translated: Having driven away all evil from us, let it pierce my enemies who hate me.

original: pṛthivyai svāhā cf / AVPariś / / hutvā🔽ā tvāhārṣam / /
analyzed: pṛthivyai svāhā hutvā  ā tvā ahārṣam
translated: Having offered to the earth with Svâhâ,🔽I have brought thee hither,
Firm is the sky,
Truth is the great,
with this Anuvâka he should offer.
That is the expiation for that.

original: atha ādityaṃ tamo gṛhṇāti tatra juhuyāt
analyzed: atha yatra etat ādityam tamaḥ gṛhṇāti tatra juhuyāt
translated: Then when the sun seizes the darkness, he should offer there:

original: divyaṃ citram ṛtūyā kalpayantam ṛtūnām ugraṃ bhramayann udeti /
analyzed: divyam citram ṛtūyā kalpayantam ṛtūnām ugram bhramayan udeti
translated: The wonderful heavenly one, arranging the seasons, rises, the fierce one of the seasons, whirling.

original: tad ādityaḥ pratarann etu sarvata āpa imāṃ lokān anusaṃcaranti //
analyzed: tat ādityaḥ prataran etu sarvatas āpaḥ imān lokān anusaṃcaranti
translated: May that sun pass over all. The waters move along these worlds.

analyzed: oṣadhībhiḥ saṃvidānau indra agnī tvā abhi rakṣatām
translated: With the plants in agreement, may Indra and Agni protect thee.

original: ṛtena satyavākena tena sarvaṃ tamo jahi //
analyzed: ṛtena satyavākena tena sarvam tamaḥ jahi
translated: With truth and true speech, by that drive away all darkness.
Having offered to the sun with Svâhâ,
The conqueror, the enduring,
with this hymn he should offer.
He worships with red (cows).
That is the expiation for that.

analyzed: atha yatra etat candramasam upaplavati tatra juhuyāt
translated: If there is an eclipse, one should offer this oblation there:

original: rāhū rājānaṃ tsarati svarantam ainam iha hanti pūrvaḥ /
analyzed: rāhuḥ rājānam tsarati svarantam ā enam iha hanti pūrvaḥ
translated: Rahu is devouring the king, the shining one, he is killing him here first.

original: sahasram asya tanva iha nāśyāḥ śataṃ tanvo vi naśyantu //
analyzed: sahasram asya tanvaḥ iha nāśyāḥ śatam tanvaḥ vi naśyantu
translated: A thousand of his bodies should perish here, a hundred bodies should be destroyed.
Having offered to Chandra,
Shakadhuma and the stars.
One should offer with this hymn.
That is the atonement there.

analyzed: atha yatra etat auṣasī na udeti tatra juhuyāt
translated: Then at dawn, one should offer there:

original: ud etu śrīr uṣasaḥ kalpayantī pūlyān kṛtvā palita etu cāraḥ /
analyzed: ud etu śrīḥ uṣasaḥ kalpayantī pūlyān kṛtvā palitaḥ etu cāraḥ
translated: May Sri arise, arranging the dawns, having made the sheep, may the thief come.

original: ṛtūn bibhratī bahudhā virūpān mahyaṃ bhavyaṃ viduṣī kalpayāti //
analyzed: ṛtūn bibhratī bahudhā virūpān mahyam bhavyam viduṣī kalpayāti
translated: Bearing the many different seasons, the wise one arranges what is auspicious for me.
Having offered to Ushas,
The divine Gandharva.
One should offer with the names of the mother.
That is the atonement there.

original: atha samā dāruṇā bhavati tatra juhuyāt
analyzed: atha yatra etat samā dāruṇā bhavati tatra juhuyāt
translated: Then if there is a terrible earthquake, one should offer there:

original: yā samā ruśaty eti prājāpatyān vi dhūnute /
analyzed: yā samā ruśatī eti prājāpatyān vi dhūnute
translated: The one that shakes and moves, destroys the offspring of Prajapati.

original: tṛptiṃ yāṃ devatā vidus tāṃ tvā saṃ kalpayāmasi //
analyzed: tṛptim yām devatāḥ viduḥ tām tvā sam kalpayāmasi
translated: We arrange you, knowing the satisfaction of the deities.
The mother of the hunter, golden-bellied, tawny.
We arrange you.

original: yat te ghoraṃ yat te viṣaṃ tad dviṣatsu ni dadhmasy amuṣminn iti brūyāt
analyzed: yat te ghoram yat te viṣam tat dviṣatsu ni dadhmasi amuṣmin iti brūyāt
translated: If he should fear, 'My oblation is not successful,' he should say, 'Whatever is terrible in you, whatever is poison in you, that we place in our enemies, in N.N.,'

original: śivenāsmākaṃ same śāntyā sahāyuṣā samāyai svāhā hutvā
analyzed: śivena asmākam same śāntyā saha āyuṣā samāyai svāhā iti hutvā
translated: having offered with 'To the auspicious one with us, with peace, with life, with prosperity, Svâhâ!'
'With the auspicious one, O Agni,
with this hymn he should offer.
That is the expiation there.

analyzed: atha yatra etat upatārakāḥ śaṅkante tatra juhuyāt
translated: If they fear that the stars will be unfavourable, he should offer there:

original: revatīḥ śubhrā iṣirā madantīs tvaco dhūmam anu tāḥ saṃ viśantu /
analyzed: revatīḥ śubhrāḥ iṣirāḥ madantīḥ tvacaḥ dhūmam anu tāḥ sam viśantu
translated: The bright, strong, rejoicing Revatîs, they enter into the smoke of the skins.

original: pareṇāpaḥ pṛthivīṃ saṃ viśantv āpa imāṃ lokān anusaṃcarantu //
analyzed: pareṇa āpaḥ pṛthivīm sam viśantu āpaḥ imān lokān anusaṃcarantu
translated: They enter into the earth beyond the waters, may the waters move along these worlds.
Having offered with 'To the waters Svâhâ!'
Let them rise up!
Let them blow forth!
He should offer the rainy season.
That is the expiation there.

original: atha brāhmaṇā āyudhino bhavanti tatra juhuyāt
analyzed: atha yatra etat brāhmaṇāḥ āyudhinaḥ bhavanti tatra juhuyāt
translated: If the Brâhmanas are armed, he should offer there:

original: ya āsurā manuṣyā āttadhanvaḥ puruṣamukhāś carān iha /
analyzed: ye āsurāḥ manuṣyāḥ ātta dhanvaḥ puruṣa mukhāḥ carān iha
translated: Those men who are Asuras, with drawn bows, with human faces, who wander here,

original: devā vayaṃ manuṣyās te devāḥ pra viśāmasi //
analyzed: devāḥ vayam manuṣyāḥ te devāḥ pra viśāmasi
translated: We are the gods, men; those gods we enter.

original: indro no astu purogavaḥ sa no rakṣatu sarvataḥ /
analyzed: indraḥ naḥ astu purogavaḥ sa naḥ rakṣatu sarvatas
translated: May Indra be our leader; may he protect us on every side.
To Indra Svâhâ.🔽Having offered,
Let them not find us!
Homage to the slayers of the gods!
One should offer with these two hymns.
That is the expiation there.

original: atha daivatāni nṛtyanti cyotanti hasanti gāyanti vānyāni vā rūpāṇi kurvanti
analyzed: atha yatra etat daivatāni nṛtyanti cyotanti hasanti gāyanti vā anyāni vā rūpāṇi kurvanti
translated: Now if the deities dance, drip, laugh, sing, or make other forms,
Those who are demons among men.
May they not know us.
Salutations to the slayers of gods.
One should offer with the fearless.
That is the expiation there.

analyzed: atha yatra etat lāṅgale saṃsṛjataḥ puroḍāśam śrapayitvā
translated: Now, having cooked the sacrificial cake for the deities,
having gone half the distance to the forest,
having established the eastern altar,
having put the eastern fuel in the middle of the altar,

original: parisamuhya paryukṣya paristīrya barhiḥ śamyāḥ paridhīn kṛtvā
analyzed: parisamuhya paryukṣya paristīrya barhiḥ śamyāḥ paridhīn kṛtvā
translated: having swept around, having sprinkled around, having strewn darbha grass, having made the enclosing sticks,
then he offers.

original: vittir asi puṣṭir asi śrīr asi prājāpatyānāṃ tāṃ tvāhaṃ mayi puṣṭikāmo juhomi svāhā
analyzed: vittiḥ asi puṣṭiḥ asi śrīḥ asi prājāpatyānām tām tvā aham mayi puṣṭi kāmaḥ juhomi svāhā
translated: You are prosperity, you are nourishment, you are the glory of the offspring of Prajapati, for the sake of nourishment I offer you into myself, svāhā.
The lotus pond Kumudvatī, the altar Śītā, beautiful in all limbs,

original: kṛṣiḥ sahasraprakārā pratyaṣṭā śrīr iyaṃ mayi //
analyzed: kṛṣiḥ sahasra prakārā pratyaṣṭā śrīḥ iyam mayi
translated: Agriculture of a thousand kinds, this prosperity is in me.

original: urvīṃ tvāhur manuṣyāḥ śriyaṃ tvā manaso viduḥ /
analyzed: urvīm tvā āhuḥ manuṣyāḥ śriyam tvā manasaḥ viduḥ
translated: Men call you the earth, the mind knows you as prosperity,

analyzed: āśaye nnasya naḥ dhehi anamīvasya śuṣmiṇaḥ
translated: In the mind, bestow upon us food that is free from disease and nourishing.
(Cf. Saṅkhya-sūtras, etc.)

analyzed: parjanya patni hariṇi abhijitā asi abhi naḥ vada
translated: O wife of Parjanya, O tawny one, O victorious one, speak to us.

original: kālanetre haviṣo no juṣasva tṛptiṃ no dhehi dvipade catuṣpade //
analyzed: kāla netre haviṣaḥ naḥ juṣasva tṛptim naḥ dhehi dvipade catuṣpade
translated: O black-eyed one, be pleased with our oblation. Bestow satisfaction upon us, upon the two-footed and four-footed.

original: yābhir devā asurān akalpayan yātūn manūn gandharvān rākṣasāṃś ca /
analyzed: yābhiḥ devāḥ asurān akalpayan yātūn manūn gandharvān rākṣasān ca
translated: By which the gods created the Asuras, the Yātudhānas, the Manus, the Gandharvas, and the Rākṣasas,

original: tābhir no adya sumanā upā gahi sahasrāpoṣaṃ subhage rarāṇā //
analyzed: tābhiḥ naḥ adya sumanāḥ upa ā gahi sahasrāpoṣam subhage rarāṇā
translated: By them, O auspicious one, come to us today with a favorable mind, bestowing a thousandfold nourishment.🔽(Cf. ...)
Wearing a garland of gold, a pond, dark, beautiful in all limbs,

original: kṛṣir hiraṇyaprakārā pratyaṣṭā śrīr iyaṃ mayi //
analyzed: kṛṣiḥ hiraṇya prakārā pratyaṣṭā śrīḥ iyam mayi
translated: Agriculture, a form of gold, this prosperity is in me.

original: aśvibhyāṃ devi saha saṃvidānā indreṇa rādhena saha puṣṭyā na ā gahi /
analyzed: aśvibhyām devi saha saṃvidānā indreṇa rādhena saha puṣṭyā naḥ ā gahi
translated: O goddess, in agreement with the Ashvins, with Indra's bounty, with nourishment, come to us.

original: viśas tvā rāsantāṃ pradiśo 'nu sarvā ahorātrārdhamāsamāsā ārtavā ṛtubhiḥ saha //
analyzed: viśaḥ tvā rāsantām pradiśaḥ nu sarvāḥ ahar rātra ardha māsa māsāḥ ārtavāḥ ṛtubhiḥ saha
translated: May the social classes, the directions, all the half-days, nights, half-months, months, seasons, together with the seasons, place you.

original: bhartrī devānām uta martyānāṃ bhartrī prajānām uta mānuṣāṇām /
analyzed: bhartrī devānām uta martyānām bhartrī prajānām uta mānuṣāṇām
translated: The supporter of the gods and also of mortals, the supporter of offspring and also of humans,
